intro: Gardenia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali gardenia, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. It produces small, dark blue berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by birds. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
